intro: Hieracium nigrescens subsp. subzinkenense, commonly known as the Zinkenense hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish to reddish composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has alternate, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, bracteate flower heads. This subspecies is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and subtle morphological differences from other Hieracium species.
